public ref class ExecutionProperties sealed : System::Collections::Generic::IEnumerable<System::Collections::Generic::KeyValuePair<System::String ^, System::Object ^>>

summary.span: Represents the collection of properties at a particular scope.

span.span: Represents the collection of properties at a particular scope.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通过线程本地存储区 (TLS)，CLR 可为每个线程维护一个执行上下文。Through thread local storage (TLS), the CLR maintains an execution context for each thread. 此执行上下文管理已知的线程属性，例如，线程标识、环境事务、当前权限集以及用户定义的线程属性（如已命名的槽）。This execution context governs well-known thread properties such as the thread identity, the ambient transaction, and the current permission set as well as user-defined thread properties like named slots. 与直接面向 CLR 的程序不同，工作流程序是在线程不可知的环境中执行的以分层形式确定范围的活动树。Unlike programs directly targeting the CLR, workflow programs are hierarchically-scoped trees that execute in a thread-agnostic environment. 这意味着标准的 TLS 机制无法直接用于确定给定工作项范围所在的上下文。This implies that the standard TLS mechanisms cannot directly be used to determine what context is in scope for a given work item. 例如，两个并行的执行分支可能使用不同的标识，但计划程序可能会在同一 CLR 线程上交错执行这两个分支。For example, two parallel branches of execution might use different identities yet the scheduler might interleave their execution on the same CLR thread. 执行属性允许活动声明哪些属性在其子树范围内，并且还提供了用于设置和关闭 TLS 以便与 CLR 对象正确交互的挂钩。Execution properties allow an activity to declare which properties are in scope for its sub-tree as well as provide hooks for setting up and tearing down TLS to properly interoperate with CLR objects.

span.span: Registers a new property.

span.span: The nearest property of the given name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用分层范围查找最接近的可见属性。 finds the nearest visible property using hierarchical scoping. 如果两个属性具有相同的名称，则返回父范围中最接近的属性。If two properties have the same name, the closest property at the parent scope is returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当活动完成后会自动注销属性。Properties are automatically unregistered when the activity completes. 此方法可用于在活动完成之前注销属性。This method can be used to unregister a property before the activity completes.
